htmlement Module¶

  • Installation
  • Why another Python HTML Parser?
  • Example

API¶

class htmlement.HTMLement(tag=None, attrs=None)[source]¶

Python HTMLParser extension with ElementTree Parser support.

This HTML Parser extends html.parser.HTMLParser returning an xml.etree.ElementTree.Element instance. The returned root element natively supports the ElementTree API. (e.g. you may use its limited support for XPath expressions)

close()[source]¶

Close the tree builder and return the root element of the element tree.

Returns:The root element of the element tree.
Return type:xml.etree.ElementTree.Element
feed(data)[source]¶

Feeds data to the parser.

Parameters:data (str) – HTML data
Raises:ValueError – If data is not of type str.
htmlement.fromstring(text, tag=None, attrs=None)[source]¶

Parses an HTML document from a string into an element tree.

Parameters:
  • text (str) – The HTML document to parse.
  • tag (str) – see HTMLement.
  • attrs (dict) – see HTMLement.
Returns:

The root element of the element tree.
Return type:

xml.etree.ElementTree.Element
Raises:

HTMLParseError – If parsing of HTML document fails.
htmlement.fromstringlist(sequence, tag=None, attrs=None)[source]¶

Parses an HTML document from a sequence of html segments into an element tree.

Parameters:
  • sequence (list) – A sequence of HTML segments to parse.
  • tag (str) – see HTMLement.
  • attrs (dict) – see HTMLement.
Returns:

The root element of the element tree.
Return type:

xml.etree.ElementTree.Element
Raises:

HTMLParseError – If parsing of HTML document fails.
htmlement.parse(source, tag=None, attrs=None)[source]¶

Load an external HTML document into element tree.

Parameters:
  • source – A filename or file object containing HTML data.
  • tag (str) – see HTMLement.
  • attrs (dict) – see HTMLement.
Returns:

The root element of the element tree.
Return type:

xml.etree.ElementTree.Element
Raises:

HTMLParseError – If parsing of HTML document fails.
htmlement.make_unicode(source, encoding=None, default_encoding='iso-8859-1')[source]¶

Convert source from type bytes to type str, if not already str.

If source is not of type str and encoding was not specified then the encoding will be extracted from source using meta tags if available. Will default to default_encoding if unable to find encoding.

Parameters:
  • source (bytes) – The html document.
  • encoding (str) – (optional) The encoding used to convert source to str.
  • default_encoding (str) – (optional) Default encoding to use when unable to extract the encoding from source.
Returns:

HTML data decoded into str(unicode).
Return type:

str
Raises:
  • UnicodeDecodeError – If decoding of source fails.
  • ValueError – If source is not of type bytes or str.
exception htmlement.HTMLParseError(msg, position=(None, None))[source]¶

Exception raised for all parse errors.
